agosuirpa.label: AGOSUIRPA
agosuirpa.tooltip: AGOSUIRPA's platform is motivated by the difficulty of finding real logs to test on them. Due to the intrusive nature of keyloggers in terms of operator privacy and customer data involved in the business processes to be automated, companies cannot share this data with third parties without the express consent of those involved. Therefore, we developed a platform, which from a seed and some configuration parameters, allows us to generate logs of the dimension we want with their associated captures.

log.label: UI log
log.tooltip: A UI log is an XML file whose grammar allows expressing event logs in Process Mining. This extension incorporates: the standard attributes of the concept, application name, event type (i.e., mouse click or keystroke), click type (i.e., left, right or center), click coordinates (i.e., mouse position on the screen) and keystroke (i.e., the keys being typed).

seed.label: seed
seed.tooltip: A seed corresponds to a small log, which has one instance for each variant of the log we want to generate. And obviously the captures associated with the activities of those cases.

activity.label: Activity
activity.tooltip: They correspond to a set of tasks or actions whose sequence results in a process. For example: opening an email, registering a user in a CRM, etc.

variant.label: Variant
variant.tooltip: A process variant is a sequence of process activities with a start event and an end event. Each variant differs from the others by at least one activity.

case.label: case
case.tooltip: Describes a business case that is executed through a particular process variant. Therefore, it is the image of exactly one process cycle.

scenario.label: scenario
scenario.tooltip: A scenario corresponds to the ecosystem of different applications that a user is going to use during the process. When we refer to variability at the scenario level, we mean that we will vary the UI elements relative to the look and feel of the different applications that appear in the process snapshots. Using the seed screenshots and varying them for the X different scenarios that we want to obtain. Those variations will be carried out once and will result in X seeds with different looks and feels.

experiment.label: experiment
experiment.tooltip: An experiment will consist of a seed, a configuration where we will indicate the size of the logs and how we want the imbalanced logs to be generated, a case-level variability configuration and optionally, scenario-level variability. Experiments will be the core of our system. We will launch an experiment every time we want to generate a series of logs associated to a process. That is, having clear the process on which we want to obtain synthetic logs, defining the experiment, we will be able to obtain the UI logs and the captures associated to that process, with the number of rows indicated in the size and the unbalanced indicated in the percentages for unbalanced logs.

balance.label: balancing
balance.tooltip: The balancing that each variant will have, for example, values such as [0.4,0.6], indicates that 40% of cases are from V1 and 60% of cases are from V2.

description.app: Variability function for the APP in the log
description.list: Variability function in data lists (coordinates, positions, etc.)
description.screenshot: Variability function for the UI from the screenshots
description.screenshot_rename: Variability function for the screenshot file rename method

description.number_words: Number of words to be generated
description.dir_level: Number of directories to be generated in the path
description.number_random_words: Number of words to be generated
description.word_configuration_max_words: Maximum number of words to be generated
description.paragraph_configuration_max_paragraph: Maximum number of paragraphs to be generated

description.Button: GUI category of a button to be change in the screenshot
description.ImageView: GUI category of an screenshot element to be change in the screenshot
description.Checkbox: GUI category of a checkbox to be change in the screenshot
description.TextInput: GUI category of a text input to be change in the screenshot, with the content of the log column with the same name
description.TextView: GUI category of a text showed in view to be change in the screenshot
description.ImageButton: GUI category of an image that acts like a button to be change in the screenshot
description.EditText: GUI category of a text edit input to be change in the screenshot
description.CheckedTextView: GUI category of a check icon in a text to be change in the screenshot
description.RadioButton: GUI category of a radio button type check to be change in the screenshot
description.ProgressBar: GUI category of a progress bar to be change in the screenshot
description.SeekBar: GUI category of a text search input to be change in the screenshot
description.NumberPicker: GUI category of a number picker to be change in the screenshot
description.Switch: GUI category of a switch selector to be change in the screenshot
description.ToggleButton: GUI category of a button as toggle to be change in the screenshot
description.RatingBar: GUI category of a rating bar to be change in the screenshot
description.Spinner: GUI category of a spinner image to be change in the screenshot

description.random_mouse_position: Generate a random mouse position. The params in order are: the down-left position of the screenshot position (2 coordinates), the resolution image (2 coordinates), and the height and widht of the UI area
description.random_id_card: Generate a random identification number for the spanish ID card
description.random_word_with_first_letter_capital: Generate a random entity. Words first letter capital
description.random_path: Generate a path with random text dir. The params are the dir level and the extension file
description.random_paragraph: Generate a random lorem ipsum paragraph
description.random_sentence: Generate a random lorem ipsum sentence
description.random_words: Generate some random lorem ipsum words
description.image_name_as_num_img_png: Generates the name of a non-existent png image
description.lorem_word_as_appname: Generate a random lorem ipsum text as app name
description.mouse_position_range_x: Generate a random mouse position for x coordinate. The params are: the down-left position of the screenshot position, the resolution image for X exe, and the widht of the element
description.mouse_position_range_y: Generate a random mouse position for y coordinate. The params are: the down-left position of the screenshot position, the resolution image for y exe, and the height of the element
description.mouse_or_keyboard: Generate a 0 or 1 in the mouse or keyboard entry of the log
description.replace_gui_component_by_other: Replace a UI element by another selected
description.given_text_in_image: Inserts in the image the text in the log column with the same name as the UI element. Example: the text in the 'Tex't' column is inserted at the location of the visual component 'Text'. The param is: the font configuration
description.hidden_gui_element: Hides a UI element with a colour. Needs the hexadecimal colour starting with # as input.
description.replace_gui_element_various_places: Replace a UI element by another selected in m√∫ltiple places. Actually without using
description.screenshot_name_without_root_path: Generate a copy of the image renamed for the log and return without relative path
description.random_text_in_image: Insert a random text in a image. The param is a text
description.random_paragraph_in_image: Insert a random paragraph in the UI element coordinates. The params are: font family, Font size, Font color, Background color, Character delimitation, Random max number of paragraph
description.random_words_in_image: Insert a random word in the UI element coordinates. The params are: Font family, Font size, Font color, Background color and delimitation Random max number of words
description.random_sentence_in_image: Insert a random sentence in the UI element coordinates. The params are: Font family, Font size, Font color, Background color and Character delimitation for paragraph
description.image_copy_renamed: Generate a copy of the image renamed for the log
description.image_copy_renamed_and_return_path: Generate a copy of the image renamed for the log and return all relative path

assist.empty: To add a modification you need to select a UI element to edit, the coordinates, the edit function and fill in its parameters
assist.download_confirmation: You will download the configuration Json and will no longer be able to configure this activity. Are you sure?
assist.back: When you go back, the changes made in the capture will be lost. Are you sure?

name.label: Name
name.helperText: The name you want to give to this experiment
name.tooltip: An experiment consist of a seed log, the size of the logs and how we want the unbalanced logs to be generated, a case-level variability configuration and optionally, the scenario-level variability configuration. Experiments are the core of our system. We will launch an experiment every time we want to generate a series of logs associated to a process. That is, defining a experiment based on a process, we obtain synthetic UI logs and the captures associated to that process, which corresponds to the variability, the size (number of rows) and the percentages for unbalanced logs indicated in the configuration.

logSize.label: Log Size
logSize.tooltip: UI logs of the sizes indicated in this field, separated by commas, are generated. These log sizes correspond to the number of rows in each log.

scenariosNumber.label: Additional scenarios
scenariosNumber.helperText: If you only want to consider the seed scenario indicate 0
scenariosNumber.tooltip: The number of scenarios to generate, that is, this field indicates how many synthetic look and feels will be generated. For each of the synthetic looks and feel generated, the correpsonding variability will be applied. If we we want only to vary our seed, i.e. we want to perform variations at the case level and not at the scenario level, we set it as 0.

seedLog.label: Seed log
seedLog.helperText: Seed log that is used to generate the rest of the synthetic log rows.
seedLog.tooltip: A seed corresponds to a small log, which has one case for each variant of the log we want to generate. Obviously, this log has screenshots associated with its rows.

screenshots.label: Screenshots
screenshots.helperText: Screenshots that appear in the seed log
screenshots.tooltip: Corresponds to the screenshots indicated in the seed log and therefore, with indicated variability and/or scenario configurations. It should be a tablet with all screenshots in the root of the tablet with the same name as indicated in the configuration json(s).

variability.label: Case Variability configuration
variability.tooltip: When we refer to variability at the case level we mean variations in the content that can be entered or modified by user, i.e. variations in the content of text inputs, selectables, checkboxes, attached images, etc.

scenario.label: Scenario Variability configuration
scenario.helperText: Scenarios variation. Look and feel of the applications involved in the process.
scenario.tooltip: We only indicate the configuration at scenario level if we want a number of scenarios greater than 0. This configuration consists of the same functions for varying UI elements at case level, but it is only aimed at varying those UI elements related to the look and feel of the applications involved in the log captures. UI elements that are the result of user actions on the system will be varied according to the configuration indicated in the case variability configuration.

imbalancedCase.label: Percentages for imbalanced logs
imbalancedCase.helperText: Percentages of the number of cases per variant in the imbalanced logs
imbalancedCase.tooltip: Number of rows per variant that the log will have in the imbalanced case. For each scenario, balanced and imbalanced logs will be generated for each of the sizes indicated. If we have a number of scenarios equal to 1, a log size '100,1000' and percentages for the imbalanced of '0.7,0.3', the experiment will get as a result two scenarios (one with the look and feel of the captures being passed, and another with synthetic variations of user inputs) with balanced and imbalanced logs, where in the second, 70% of the rows will correspond to variant 1 and 30% of variant 2, and with 100 and 1000 rows independently of their balance

errors.screenShotsRequired: Please enter a zip with the screenshots
errors.scenarioRequired: Please enter a valid screenshots configuration file
errors.logSizeRequired: Please enter a valid log size separated by commas
errors.imbalancedCaseRequired: Please enter valid imbalanced case percentages separated by commas
errors.variabilityRequired: Please enter a valid variability configuration file

errors.idCodeMustNotContainsWhiteSpace: The unique identifier must not contains white spaces
errors.idCodeMustBeUnique: This identifier is being used by another component

errors.repeatedPasswordRequired: You must repeat the new password
